text: In some languages including Java, C/C++, C#, etc.
you can assign a value based on the result of an inline boolean expression.
This will return i if i < x, otherwise it will return x.  I like this because it is much more compact in many cases than the longer syntax which follows.

code:
if (i < x)
  return i
else
  return x

text: Is it possible to use this syntax in python and if so, how?
